items.title: 'Long history of blaming mothers': Trump's Tylenol warning echoes past misconceptions
items.description: Medical scholars say, efforts to find a singular cause for autism has historically led to scrutinizing parents and fueling stigma about autism

items.title: The U.N. utters the word: Dementia
items.description: For the first time, the United Nations has put forward a political declaration pledging to address dementia. Will it make a difference?

items.title: Trump advises parents on hepatitis B vaccine. Here's why doctors say he's wrong
items.description: It's unusual for presidents to give medical advice. But this week, President Trump told parents to delay giving their kids a hep b shot until they tur...

items.title: VIDEO: Trump and scientists disagree on Tylenol and autism. Who do Americans believe?
items.description: President Trump linked Tylenol to autism despite little medical evidence. How are Americans meant to make important decisions about their health at th...

items.title: Leucovorin for autism? Many scientists — and parents — are skeptical
items.description: President Trump says an old drug that acts like a vitamin can reduce autism symptoms in many children. The science doesn't support that claim.
